title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:57 <mihaipaun> has quit  
01:23 <Enygma`> has quit  
01:33 <bumbu> has quit  
01:36 <abusenius> has quit  
02:17 <sdumitriu> has quit  
02:36 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
03:11 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
03:24 <DrLou> has quit  
04:39 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
04:39 <venkatesh> has quit  
05:17 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
05:18 <jvdrean> has quit  
05:28 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
05:46 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <anurup> Hello , My name is Anurup Raveendran. I am a final year student in Model Engineering College,Cochin,India. I have gone through the project ideas page and find the "Calendar Application" project very interesting. I have done work in PHP and Javascript before. I have designed 2 websites. I have installed and configured XWiki Enterprise on my system. It would be great if someone could guide me on this project.  
06:05 <jvdrean> has quit  
06:31 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
06:45 <@cjdelisle> Not sure there is any guidance to be had. If you have a specific question then I can try to answer it.  
06:53 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
06:53 <anurup> cjdelisle: ok well i tried installing the calendarevent application on my xwiki but i'm not able to load it. i copied the plugin to the web-inf/lib folder and changed the xwiki.cfg and uploaded the xar file but its not loading.  
06:56 <mihaipaun> has joined #xwiki  
06:57 <@cjdelisle> I have not ever installed the calander myself so i wouldn't know where to begin. Did you edit xwiki.cfg to add a line for the plugin?  
06:57 <mpaun> has quit  
07:00 <anurup> cjdelisle: yes i did  
07:01 <@cjdelisle> you say you "uploaded" the xar file. I assume by that you mean "went to the administration interface, clicked 'import', uploaded it, clicked on it, and clicked import".  
07:02 <anurup> yes that's what i meant  
07:03 <@cjdelisle> you could check the logs to see if something is going wrong with the plugin.  
07:03 <@cjdelisle> find file: xwiki.log  
07:03 <anurup> ok hold on  
07:04 <Denis> has quit  
07:08 <anurup> the only error that i could find  related to calendar is  
07:08 <anurup> SEVERE: [/var/lib/tomcat6/webapps/xwiki/resources/js/yui/calendar] could not be completely deleted. The presence of the remaining files may cause problems  
07:08 <anurup> Apr 8, 2011 12:39:25 AM org.apache.catalina.startup.ExpandWar deleteDir  
07:08 <anurup> SEVERE: [/var/lib/tomcat6/webapps/xwiki/resources/js/yui/autocomplete] could not be completely deleted. The presence of the remaining files may cause problems  
07:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:09 <@cjdelisle> tomcat's up to 6 now ay?  
07:10 <anurup> yea  
07:10 <anurup> is that a problem?  
07:10 <@cjdelisle> I don't know. When I have a problem I usually find the error and start reading code where the stacktrace ended.  
07:10 <@cjdelisle> nah, just me musing  
07:11 <anurup> hehe ok  
07:16 <anurup> apparently the same error is happening for someone else too but no one has posted a solution there  
07:19 <anurup> cjdelisle: the project requires only js skills but apps are developed in java right?  
07:19 <@cjdelisle> I don't think any of our projects require \_only\_ js skill.  
07:20 <@cjdelisle> most stuff is done in velocity which is a reduced version of java  
07:20 <@cjdelisle> "velocity templating language"  
07:20 <@cjdelisle> ^-->google  
07:20 <anurup> ok  
07:31 <mihaipaun> has quit  
07:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:01 <vmassol> has quit  
08:40 <Avipar> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <khyati> has joined #xwiki  
09:00 <kasun> has quit  
09:00 <Avipar> has quit  
09:01 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <vmassol> has quit  
09:21 <vmassol1> good morning  
09:21 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
09:27 <@cjdelisle> I'm thinking maybe the new development model should be allowed to evolve rather than being enforced.  
09:30 <@cjdelisle> Speaking for myself, I'm still in a largely svn way of thinking. I don't think committers should be asked to do pull requests since that just adds to the complecation.  
09:30 <Avipar> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <@cjdelisle> When I was doing dns-p2p with some other people, I remember just merging changes took a lot of time.  
09:33 <vmassol> yep I agree  
09:33 <vmassol> you seen my last reply to sergiu of a few minutes ago?  
09:33 <vmassol> (cjdelisle)  
09:34 <@cjdelisle> Yes, replying now.  
09:35 <@cjdelisle> IMO lets start with something very close to what we used to do and then we can discover new ideas and git features over time.  
09:35 <vmassol> cjdelisle: this is why I like http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/  
09:35 <vmassol> it's almost exactly what we were doing  
09:35 <vmassol> just switch master <—> develop  
09:36 <vmassol> I personally prefer that master be the develop branch and have a stable branch  
09:36 <@cjdelisle> +1  
09:43 <vmassol> hmm I don't understand why git did merges for my changes on xwiki-platform-core...  
09:43 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <vmassol> there were no changes on origin/master so git merge should have done a ff as I understand it  
09:43 <vmassol> "However, if the current branch has not diverged from the other--so every commit present in the current branch is already contained in the other--then git just performs a "fast forward";"  
09:43 <vmassol> from: http://book.git-scm.com/3\_basic\_branching\_and\_merging.html  
09:46 <@cjdelisle> I have found I really never have had to use git-merge. I always use rebase to pull in changes.  
09:47 <vmassol> cjdelisle: indeed, except if your branch is public  
09:47 <vmassol> in which case people can have done changes and you're going to mess them up  
09:48 <@cjdelisle> are you thinking of reset or am I forgetting how I was using it?  
09:52 <gsoc\_sapan\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <khyati> has quit  
10:06 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <Avipar> has quit  
10:11 <@cjdelisle> jdo + cassandra is win  
10:11 <@cjdelisle> All I have to do is slap a @Index over a field and it makes an index in cassandra so I can query against that field.  
10:13 <@cjdelisle> By itself, cassandra is hard to deal with IE: you have to plan all of your queries when you make the schema  
10:16 <gsoc\_sapan\_> has quit

11:02 <vmassol2> has joined #xwiki  
11:02 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki

11:06 <vmassol1> has quit  
11:06 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <fmancinelli1> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <mihaipaun> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <mpaun> has quit  
11:24 <@sdumitriu> vmassol2: Where you looking for me?  
11:24 <vmassol2> sdumitriu: hi  
11:24 <vmassol2> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:24 <vmassol> yes  
11:25 <vmassol> I'd like to move on with the new commons reorg  
11:25 <vmassol> but I need your help to move everything in xwiki-commons/  
11:25 <vmassol> once they are there I can then make the reorg  
11:25 <vmassol> (ie group all commons\* repo into one)  
11:26 <+tmortagne> would probably be easier to move things in xwiki-commons-core and rename it (and delete the other one)  
11:26 <+tmortagne> it's a lot less stuff to move  
11:26 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: K, on to it  
11:27 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Indeed  
11:27 <Danker> has quit  
11:27 <mihaipaun> has quit  
11:27 <vmassol> thanks  
11:28 <@sdumitriu> Please don't commit in commons  
11:28 <vmassol> k  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> Push now if you have something to push  
11:29 <vmassol> nothing to push on my side  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: FYI, I have aliased up=pull origin --rebase  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> So "git up" does rebase by default  
11:30 <vmassol> that works if I don't share my local branch right? (ie  if people haven't forked it or they'll be messed up)?  
11:30 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
11:35 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Hi!  
11:36 <@sdumitriu> Hi Dirk  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] I'm looking for a velocity fragment checking the group membership.  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] I wan't to to something like:  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)]  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] #if ($xwiki.hasAccessLevel("view", $context.user, "Literatur.WebHome"))  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] \* [Literatur>Literatur.WebHome]  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] #end  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)]  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] (Quicklinks Panel)  
11:37 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] But it should be more general grouped by group memberships.  
11:41 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <mpaun\_> has quit  
11:43 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <vmassol> sdumitriu: eta for commons? (need to organize my work)  
11:49 <vmassol> (note: I have all the poms ready to be committed after you finish the move)  
11:49 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: A few more minutes  
11:49 <vmassol> ok cool  
11:53 <@sdumitriu> Checking everything is OK before pushing  
11:55 <mpaun\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <@sdumitriu> Pushed, renaming repos  
11:57 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] In 2.7.1 I'm the resulting message for a renamed page is:  
11:57 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Seite Space.OLD in Space {3} erfolgreich in Seite Space.NEW im Space {4} umbenannt.  
11:57 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] If this a known defect ?  
11:58 <happyfeet11> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <@sdumitriu> Probably a translation that's not updated  
11:58 <@sdumitriu> Or no, looks like a translation that's ahead of the platform  
11:59 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: You shouldn't edit translations  
11:59 <pacman\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <@sdumitriu> You should use a new translation key  
12:12 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: All done  
12:13 <Chami1> has quit  
12:14 <vmassol> sdumitriu: thanks,can I push?  
12:14 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
12:14 <vmassol> sdumitriu: there's still the xwiki-commons-pom repo on https://github.com/xwiki  
12:17 <vmassol> done  
12:19 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
12:20 <vmassol> sdumitriu: could you do platform now?  
12:20 <vmassol> xwiki-platform (repo)  
12:20 <vmassol> |\_ xwiki-platform-tools  
12:20 <vmassol> |\_ xwiki-platform-core  
12:20 <@sdumitriu> K  
12:20 <vmassol> sdumitriu: don't froget to remove xwiki-commons-pom  
12:21 <@sdumitriu> So you're sure it's gonna work?  
12:21 <vmassol> well at least it builds fine  
12:21 <vmassol> you could try to check if it works for you  
12:21 <@sdumitriu> K, I trust you  
12:22 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: There was another question I asked a few days ago  
12:22 <@sdumitriu> About applications and older branches  
12:22 <kasun> has quit  
12:22 <vmassol> what was the question?  
12:22 <@sdumitriu> If I want to fix something in administration for 2.7.2, how do we do it?  
12:22 <vmassol> no idea...  
12:22 <@sdumitriu> One option was to git co xwiki-2.7 && git merge xwiki-application-administration-1.41.1  
12:22 <vmassol> do we have to?  
12:23 <vmassol> (make changes to 2.7)  
12:23 <@sdumitriu> This adds xwiki-platform-adminisration in the 2.7 branch  
12:23 <vmassol> well the pb is the same with 3.0 I guess  
12:23 <pacman\_> has quit  
12:23 <@sdumitriu> No, we don't \*have\* to, we can always leave bugs in it  
12:24 <vmassol> we coudl say we don't make any fixes in apps and plugins in 3.0 branch  
12:24 <vmassol> (especially since 3.0 is the first release of a cycle)  
12:24 <vmassol> do you think that could work?  
12:24 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Shouldn't we move web first?  
12:25 <vmassol> before tools?  
12:25 <vmassol> they are at the same level  
12:25 <vmassol> I'd prefer tools first  
12:26 <vmassol> (since they come before in the build order)  
12:26 <vmassol> but whatever order you want  
12:26 <@sdumitriu> Same level? I though web should be moved inside core  
12:26 <vmassol> yes  
12:26 <vmassol> no  
12:26 <vmassol> in platform  
12:26 <vmassol> (not core)  
12:26 <vmassol> xwiki-platform  
12:26 <vmassol> ah yes  
12:26 <vmassol> sorry  
12:26 <vmassol> mixed up  
12:27 <vmassol> let's start again  
12:27 <vmassol> :)  
12:27 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Available?  
12:27 <vmassol> indeed web will be moved in xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-core/  
12:27 <vmassol> sdumitriu: all I need is that you move stuff in xwiki-)platform  
12:28 <vmassol> then I can handle it  
12:28 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: so so  
12:28 <+mflorea> how can I help?  
12:28 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Another defect ?  
12:28 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Renaming of  a group document results in the loss of all rights on spaces and documents.  
12:28 <@sdumitriu> Can you tell me how should platform-web be split into components to go into platform-core?  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> Dirk: Yes, that's "normal", since there's no real rename; rename = copy + delete, and the deletion triggers the rights update  
12:29 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I proposed something and marius replied to it  
12:29 <vmassol> (in the mail)  
12:29 <vmassol> there was an open question  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: markmail?  
12:29 <+mflorea> yes, did you read it?  
12:29 <vmassol> IMO wysiwyg is enough for now probably  
12:29 <vmassol> mflorea: do you want -gwt ?  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> I've too many mails to read, so I skip them :)  
12:30 <+mflorea> vmassol: I agree, wysiwyg top level module is enough, but note that the current platform/web/gwt module can't go in, so we'll have a top level xwiki-platoform-gwt(-api) module anyway  
12:31 <vmassol> ah  
12:31 <vmassol> then  
12:31 <vmassol> why not do:  
12:31 <vmassol> |\_ xwiki-platform-gwt  
12:31 <vmassol>   |\_ xwiki-platform-gwt-api  
12:31 <vmassol>   |\_ xwiki-platform-gwt-dom  
12:31 <vmassol>   |\_ xwiki-platform-gwt-user  
12:31 <vmassol> |\_ xwiki-platform-wysiwyg  
12:31 <vmassol>   |\_ xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-client  
12:31 <vmassol>   |\_ xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-plugin-api  
12:31 <vmassol>   |\_ xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-server  
12:31 <vmassol>   |\_ xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-war  
12:31 <vmassol> (what you proposed)  
12:32 <vmassol> sdumitriu: thread is  [VOTE] Directory/Git Reorganization re platform vs extensions  
12:32 <+mflorea> yes, that is good too, but it's just because we have this platform/web/gwt module that is not used anymore in the platform and we have to leave with it..  
12:32 <vmassol> hmm  
12:32 <vmassol> if it's not used why do we keep it?  
12:32 <@sdumitriu> I think Ludo uses it  
12:32 <vmassol> so xwiki-platform-gwt-api is the one not used anymore?  
12:32 <@sdumitriu> In all the "live editing" stuff he does  
12:32 <+mflorea> yes  
12:32 <+mflorea> I think it is used only in curriki and watch  
12:33 <+lucaa> there's also an application that uses that  
12:33 <+mflorea> but it's an "api", and lucaa argued a week ago i think that we can't remove it because there might be people outhre using it  
12:33 <vmassol> ok let's expose -gwt FTM  
12:34 <+lucaa> to live edit table cells  
12:34 <vmassol> it doesn't hurt I think  
12:34 <vmassol> we can decide what we do with gwt-api after  
12:34 <+mflorea> sure  
12:34 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ok?  
12:34 <@sdumitriu> So, the tree you posted up?  
12:34 <+mflorea> +1 for 2 top level module, gwt and wysiwyg  
12:35 <+mflorea> vmassol: we need a "gwt" component in jira for this  
12:35 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes  
12:35 <vmassol> mflorea: yes  
12:35 <@sdumitriu> K, on to it  
12:35 <+mflorea> "GWT APIs"  
12:36 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
12:36 <vmassol> cjdelisle: like this: http://images.cheezburger.com/completestore/2011/4/8/563f7572-57b8-4578-9eac-607975c0f990.jpg ? :)  
12:37 <pacman> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <vmassol> (just kidding of course)  
12:37 <@cjdelisle> indeed. It's perfectly optimized for square roads  
12:38 <vmassol> hehe  
12:38 <@cjdelisle> It has the best tire to ground surface area of any bicycle available.  
12:38 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:39 <pacman> vmassol: I would love add the autocomplete functionality to the wysiwys editor as part of the GSoC program  
12:40 <vmassol> pacman: cool  
12:41 <vmassol> going for lunch, bb in 1 hour  
12:42 <@sdumitriu> No commits in platform, K?  
12:44 <pacman> has quit  
12:54 <pacman> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <pacman> question would be, will it be possible to add the AJS library to the xwiki bundle  
12:59 <@sdumitriu> Pushed web  
12:59 <@sdumitriu> Going out for a couple of hours, I'll continue with tools after that

14:15 <ihalip> worked for me a few minutes ago  
14:22 <happyfeet11> has quit  
14:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I guess I should wait for the move of xwiki-platform-core to xwiki-platform before making any change right?  
14:27 <Chami1> has quit  
14:34 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping me when you're back so that we can sync  
14:35 <khyati> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <Denis> has quit  
14:43 <khyati> i have a query related to the project improved Color Theme Wizard--i.e how the users would be using the themes provided to them.??  
14:44 <khyati> are they allowed to download the theme editor??  
14:45 <khyati> i want to know this as whether the users have their own profiles on which they can apply these themes??  
14:50 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
14:51 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Ping  
14:51 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I guess I should wait for the move of xwiki-platform-core to xwiki-platform before making any change right?  
14:51 <khyati> can anybody answer my query??  
14:52 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Yes  
14:52 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you're doing it now?

15:46 <+mflorea> vmassol: how do you put XML snippet in javadoc? I used {@code} but I get "Extra HTML tag found" from checkstype about one of the tags inside the code. That xml is of course not valid, but it's an example and checkstyle shouldn't validate inside {@code}  
15:48 <vmassol> you could escape all tags but tedious, Idon't know, need to try it out myself  
15:48 <tmortagne1> yeo you have to escape all XML stuff  
15:48 <tmortagne1> s/yeo/yep/  
15:48 <+mflorea> hmm, that a PITA  
15:49 <vmassol> mflorea: ahve you checked if there's a more recent version of checkstyle?  
15:49 <tmortagne1> with code i'm not sure actually but all the javadoc i seen always escaped xml stuff  
15:49 <+mflorea> the problem is that I can't use @code if I escape XML chars  
15:49 <+mflorea> because it prints them escaped  
15:49 <+mflorea> vmassol: no, I haven't checked  
15:49 <vmassol> yes don't escape with @code  
15:50 <+mflorea> I'll use pre and escape  
15:52 <vmassol> mflorea: to try out it's easy  
15:52 <vmassol> simple add a dependency on chckstyle 5.3 in the maven checkstyle plugin declaration in the top level pom  
15:52 <vmassol> <plugin>….  
15:52 <vmassol>     <dependency>...  
15:53 <vmassol> this will override the version of checkstyle used by the maven plugin  
15:53 <vmassol> version 2.6 of the maven checkstyle plugin uses checkstyle 5.0  
15:53 <vmassol> that said this issue isn't mentioned explicitly on: http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/releasenotes.html  
15:54 <+mflorea> I'll try, but for the moment I need to fix the real issue I was working on :)  
15:54 <vmassol> :)  
15:54 <vmassol> mflorea: could it be this issue: http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1524767&group\_id=29721&atid=397078 ?  
15:55 <vmassol> (note that the bug is against checkstyle 4.2)  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> Strange, same thing happened... I'll commit it as it is, hoping that it's not important  
15:55 <vmassol> ah the comment says it's still present in 5.0  
15:55 <+mflorea> vmassol: yes, that seems to be the issue, @code is not handled correctly
